Key Match Events: Lungi Ngidi took 1 wicket for 13 runs
Bjorn Fortuin scored 26 runs off 32 balls
Craig Young took 3 wickets for 34 runs
Mark Adair took 4 wickets for 39 runs
Ryan Rickelton and Tristan Stubbs mounted a remarkable fightback with a 152-run partnership
Pre-Game Insights: Temba Bavuma, SA Captain: We’re going to bat. It’s a good wicket, with nice grass covering on it. Want to make use of the good batting conditions.
Paul Stirling, IRE Captain: Very proud moment (to play 400 games), back to business though, we’ve got a game to win. It was a difficult decision at the toss, happy to have a bowl.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa have posted a fighting total on the board, despite early trouble in the first ODI against Ireland.
Ireland need 272 runs to record their second ever victory against South Africa in ODIs.
Ryan Rickelton is in for a quick word. He starts by saying that they found themselves under pressure early on as the ball moved significantly, making batting challenging.
Others: The match was played at Sheikh Zayed Stadium in Abu Dhabi.

The playing XI for South Africa included Ryan Rickelton, Tony de Zorzi, Temba Bavuma, Rassie van der Dussen, Tristan Stubbs, Wiaan Mulder, Andile Phehlukwayo, Bjorn Fortuin, Lizaad Williams, Lungi Ngidi, and Ottneil Baartman.
The playing XI for Ireland included Paul Stirling, Andrew Balbirnie, Curtis Campher, Harry Tector, Stephen Doheny, George Dockrell, Andy McBrine, Mark Adair, Craig Young, Graham Hume, and Gavin Hoey.
